item.title: Fault Tolerance in Distributed Systems
item.description: No systems can provide fault-free guarantees, including distributed systems. However, failures in distributed systems are independent. It means only a subset of processes fail at once. We can exploit this feature and provide some degree of fault tolerance. The problem is, fault tolerance makes everything else much more difficult.
